Feature: Is there directional or locative morphological marking on verbs?
Comment: "Like other Tungusic languages (cf. Stojnova 2016, to appear), the North Tungusic languages have an associated motion suffix –nA that expresses mainly andative meanings, but can have ventive readings as well. This adds a directional argument to the argument structure”
Example:
(Bystraja dialect)
nan gasči-na-ri-n akan-taki-n ašatka-m 
and ask.for-AM-PST-3SG father-ALL-POSS.3SG girl-ACC 
‘And he went to the girl's father to ask for her (hand in marriage).’
